review: "Tom Sawyer Abroad" is a whimsical and often humorous adventure that sees Twain’s classic characters exploring the wilds of Africa. While the premise is intriguing and the narrative retains Twain’s characteristic wit, the story feels a bit thin and lacks the depth and social commentary of his more celebrated works. Still, it’s a fun read for fans of the series and those who enjoy light-hearted, adventurous tales.
